title: Editors Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Fri Feb 2, 2018 | 8:00am EST Editors Choice Pictures 
The super blue moon illuminates Mayon Volcano as it spews lava during a mild eruption, hours after a total lunar eclipse in Legazpi, Philippines. REUTERS/Erik De Castro   The super blue moon illuminates Mayon Volcano as it spews lava during a mild eruption, hours after a total lunar eclipse in Legazpi, Philippines. REUTERS/Erik De Castro Close 1 / 24 
Martin Rodriguez looks at a damaged street outside his house,   Comerio,   Thursday, February 01, 2018 Martin Rodriguez looks at a damaged street outside his house,   Comerio,   2 / 24 
A policeman takes part in an operation against drug dealers in the Cidade de Deus slum in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. REUTERS/Ricardo Moraes   A policeman takes part in an operation against drug dealers in the Cidade de Deus slum in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. REUTERS/Ricardo Moraes Close 3 / 24 
Fire victims sift through the ruins of their houses that were gutted by a fire in Paranaque, Metro Manila, Philippines. REUTERS/Erik De Castro Reuters / Friday, February 02, 2018 Fire victims sift through the ruins of their houses that were gutted by a fire in Paranaque, Metro Manila, Philippines. REUTERS/Erik De Castro Close 4 / 24 
A passenger looks at security personnel deployed at the Beijing Railway Station as the annual Spring Festival travel rush begins ahead of the Chinese Lunar New Year, in central Beijing, China. REUTERS/Damir Sagolj   A passenger looks at security personnel deployed at the Beijing Railway Station as the annual Spring Festival travel rush begins ahead of the Chinese Lunar New Year, in central Beijing, China. REUTERS/Damir Sagolj Close 
Local residents ride on a bus in the city of Guantanamo, Cuba. REUTERS/Carlos Barria Reuters / Friday, February 02, 2018 Local residents ride on a bus in the city of Guantanamo, Cuba. REUTERS/Carlos Barria Close 6 / 24 
French President Emmanuel Macron wears a fez during his tour of the Medina (old town) of the Tunisian capital Tunis, Tunisia. REUTERS/Eric Feferberg/Pool   French President Emmanuel Macron wears a fez during his tour of the Medina (old town) of the Tunisian capital Tunis, Tunisia. REUTERS/Eric Feferberg/Pool Close 
North Korean athletes arrive at the the Olympic Village in Gangneung, South Korea. REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji   North Korean athletes arrive at the the Olympic Village in Gangneung, South Korea. REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji Close 8 / 24 
Muslim Senegalese American Fatou Goumbala takes part in a World Hijab Day rally held in front of New York City Hall in Manhattan. REUTERS/Amr Alfiky   Muslim Senegalese American Fatou Goumbala takes part in a World Hijab Day rally held in front of New York City Hall in Manhattan. REUTERS/Amr Alfiky Close 9 / 24 
Young boys swim in a road under repair in Tondo district, metro Manila, Philippines. REUTERS/Dondi Tawatao   Young boys swim in a road under repair in Tondo district, metro Manila, Philippines. REUTERS/Dondi Tawatao Close 10 / 24 
People crowd around the carcass of a 17 meter long sperm whale washed ashore in Bombana Regency, Southeast Sulawesi Province, Indonesia. Antara Foto/Jojon/via REUTERS Reuters / Friday, February 02, 2018 People crowd around the carcass of a 17 meter long sperm whale washed ashore in Bombana Regency, Southeast Sulawesi Province, Indonesia. Antara Foto/Jojon/via REUTERS Close 11 / 24 
Sri Lanka's military members march with the national flags at the parade during a rehearsal for Sri Lanka's 70th Independence day celebrations in Colombo, Sri Lanka. REUTERS/Dinuka Liyanawatte Reuters / Friday, February 02, 2018 Sri Lanka's military members march with the national flags at the parade during a rehearsal for Sri Lanka's 70th Independence day celebrations in Colombo, Sri Lanka. REUTERS/Dinuka Liyanawatte Close 12 / 24 
Children play football at what used to be a coal mine in Jerada, Morocco. REUTERS/Youssef Boudlal Reuters / Friday, February 02, 2018 Children play football at what used to be a coal mine in Jerada, Morocco. REUTERS/Youssef Boudlal Close 13 / 24 
Barrio 18 gang members sit in court awaiting their sentences in San Salvador, El Salvador. REUTERS/Jose Cabezas Reuters / Friday, February 02, 2018 Barrio 18 gang members sit in court awaiting their sentences in San Salvador, El Salvador. REUTERS/Jose Cabezas Close 14 / 24 
Michigan State University student Isabella Ndlebe stops to look at "The Rock" painted with the names of assault victims of Larry Nassar, a former team USA Gymnastics doctor who pleaded guilty in November 2017 to sexual assault, in East Lansing,... more   Michigan State University student Isabella Ndlebe stops to look at "The Rock" painted with the names of assault victims of Larry Nassar, a former team USA Gymnastics doctor who pleaded guilty in November 2017 to sexual assault, in East Lansing, Michigan. REUTERS/Rebecca Cook Close 15 / 24 
Workers roll out a red carpet for Britain's Prince William and Catherine, the Duchess of Cambridge, to walk down on their arrival at Gardermoen Airport in Oslo, Norway. REUTERS/Hannah McKay   Workers roll out a red carpet for Britain's Prince William and Catherine, the Duchess of Cambridge, to walk down on their arrival at Gardermoen Airport in Oslo, Norway. REUTERS/Hannah McKay Close 16 / 24 
Boston Celtics forward Marcus Morris is upended by New York Knicks forward Michael Beasley after dunking. Winslow Townson-USA TODAY Sports   Boston Celtics forward Marcus Morris is upended by New York Knicks forward Michael Beasley after dunking. Winslow Townson-USA TODAY Sports Close 17 / 24 
China Railway High-speed Harmony bullet trains are seen at a high-speed train maintenance base, as the Spring Festival travel rush begins, in Wuhan, Hubei province, China. REUTERS/Darley Shen   China Railway High-speed Harmony bullet trains are seen at a high-speed train maintenance base, as the Spring Festival travel rush begins, in Wuhan, Hubei province, China. REUTERS/Darley Shen   19 / 24 
Angel Colon plays the guitar outside a little hut, in which he lives since his house was destroyed during Hurricane Maria in September 2017, in Comerio,   Thursday, February 01, 2018 Angel Colon plays the guitar outside a little hut, in which he lives since his house was destroyed during Hurricane Maria in September 2017, in Comerio,   
People ride the world's longest zip-line over Ras al-Khamiah's Jabal Jais Mountain, UAE. REUTERS/Ahmed Jadallah   People ride the world's longest zip-line over Ras al-Khamiah's Jabal Jais Mountain, UAE. REUTERS/Ahmed Jadallah Close 21 / 24 
North Korean defector Ji Seong-ho, currently a law student at Dongguk University, holds up his crutches during U.S. President Donald Trump's State of the Union address to a joint session of the U.S. Congress on Capitol Hill. REUTERS/Jonathan Ernst   North Korean defector Ji Seong-ho, currently a law student at Dongguk University, holds up his crutches during U.S. President Donald Trump's State of the Union address to a joint session of the U.S. Congress on Capitol Hill. REUTERS/Jonathan Ernst Close 22 / 24 
A full moon 'supermoon' is pictured next to the statue of Christ the Redeemer in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. REUTERS/Ricardo Moraes   A full moon 'supermoon' is pictured next to the statue of Christ the Redeemer in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. REUTERS/Ricardo Moraes Close 23 / 24 
Artist Daria Marchenko attempts to adjust the lighting to properly capture a portrait of President Trump made of coins and casino tokens by herself and Daniel D. Green in a classroom in New York. REUTERS/Lucas Jackson   Artist Daria Marchenko attempts to adjust the lighting to properly capture a portrait of President Trump made of coins and casino tokens by herself and Daniel D. Green in a classroom in New York. REUTERS/Lucas Jackson Close
